org.jetel.hadoop.connection

Class HadoopConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.graph.GraphElement
      • org.jetel.hadoop.connection.HadoopConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IConnection, IGraphElement

    public class HadoopConnection
extends GraphElement
implements IConnection

    Represents configurable connection to Hadoop cluster. Allows for both file system and map/reduce operations on the cluster. However, a use case is supported when instance of this class is used only to connect to Hadoop file system.

    This class initializes and connects services that perform file system and map/reduce operations. They are connected according to user specified connection configuration. The services provided do not offer connection related operations as this class alone should take care of connection management.

    TODO to avoid code duplication and unnecessary methods (like createMetadata(Properties)) perhaps common superclass for Connections should be introduced and this class should be made its descendant. For example such class can take care of exporting and externalization of the connections.
    See Also:
    HadoopProvidersFactory, HadoopJobSender, HadoopWriter, HadoopReader, HadoopConnectingFileSystemService, HadoopConnectingMapReduceService

    • Constructor Detail

      • HadoopConnection

        public HadoopConnection(java.lang.String id,
                java.util.Properties initProperties,
                GraphParameters graphParameters)
        Constructs not initialized Hadoop connection.
        Parameters:
        id - Id of the connection.
        initProperties - Configuration of the connection as specified by user. The property keys are XML constants of this class.
        graphProperties - Properties used to resolve CTL expressions in connection configuration.
        See Also:
        init()

    • Method Detail

      • fromXML

        public static HadoopConnection fromXML(TransformationGraph graph,
                       org.w3c.dom.Element nodeXML)
                                throws XMLConfigurationException,
                                       AttributeNotFoundException
        Creates new instance of HadoopConnection. Initialization is delayed to init method. This just transforms graph to properties that are stored in attribute.
        Parameters:
        graph - Graph this new connection is part of.
        nodeXML - XML node corresponding to new connection.
        Returns:
        Not initialized instance of HadoopConnection.
        Throws:
        XMLConfigurationException - If ID attribute of the connection is not found.
        AttributeNotFoundException

      • getMapReduceInfoService

        public static HadoopMapReduceInfoService getMapReduceInfoService(java.lang.String hadoopVersion,
                                                 java.net.URL contextURL,
                                                 java.lang.String hadoopCoreJars)
        Creates instance of HadoopMapReduceInfoService for given version of Hadoop API, URLs to required Hadoop libraries and context URL for resolving relative paths to those libraries. This methos is intended to be used in situations there no instance of HadoopConnection is available for example in Designer.
        Parameters:
        hadoopVersion - Non-null nor empty string specifying version of Hadoop API for which corresponding service provider is returned. If not supported API version is specified null is returned.
        contextURL - Context URL for resolving relative paths to Hadoop API libraries. May not be null.
        hadoopCoreJars - URLs separated by HadoopConnection#LIB_PATH_SEPARATOR to required Hadoop libraries and context URL for resolving relative paths to those libraries. If null or empty no Hadoop API libraries are loaded.
        Returns:
        Service providing operations that might be vary with different Hadoop API version but do not need connection to Hadoop cluster to be performed.
        See Also:
        getMapReduceInfoService()

      • init

        public void init()
          throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Initializes the connection. Calling this method is prerequisite to some other operations. If XML_CONFIG_KEY value was specified this method reads connection configuration from specified file first (more precisely, loaded connection properties are added to current properties, possibly overwriting already existing ones). Then services needed for communication with Hadoop cluster are instantiated based on configuration of this connection, but they are not yet connected here. Connection is established lazily by calling getFileSystemService() or getMapReduceService() method.
        Specified by:
        init in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        init in class GraphElement
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - some of the required resource is not available or other precondition is not accomplish
        See Also:
        GraphElement.isInitialized(), getFileSystemService(), getMapReduceService(), getMapReduceInfoService()

      • checkConfig

        public ConfigurationStatus checkConfig(ConfigurationStatus status)
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        Checks the configuration of this graph element. This method should verify that all required parameters are set and that the element can be used. This method might be called before graph execution, in such case it will be called before the IGraphElement.init() method. It is not guaranteed that this method will ever be called, but also this method may be called repeatedly. All resources allocated in this method should be freed in this method too.
        Specified by:
        checkConfig in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        checkConfig in class GraphElement

      • getFileSystemService

        public HadoopFileSystemService getFileSystemService()
                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Gets service that allows performing file system operations on Hadoop cluster file system. This service is connected to Hadoop cluster as specified in configuration of HadoopConnection. For example in case the file system is HDFS it is connected to namenode of Hadoop cluster as configured. This method may only be called after successful initialization of the connection.
        Returns:
        Adequate file system service connected to Hadoop cluster file system as specified by user in configuration of HadoopConnection. Never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getFileSystemServiceUnconnected

        public HadoopFileSystemService getFileSystemServiceUnconnected()
        As getFileSystemServiceUnconnected(), but without assurance that the service will be connected to a namenode. Few operations of the service may not require the connection to be active, e.g. creation of a sequence file parser. init() has to be called before this method.
        Returns:
        Adequate file system service as specified by user in configuration of HadoopConnection. ONever returns null.

      • getMapReduceService

        public HadoopMapReduceService getMapReduceService()
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Gets service for sending Hadoop map/reduce jobs to Hadoop cluster jobtracter. This service is connected to jobtracker specified in configuration of HadoopConnection and thus the jobs are sent to that jobtracker. This method may only be called after successful initialization of the connection.
        Returns:
        Adequate map/reduce service connected to jobtracker as specified by user in configuration of HadoopConnection. Never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If init() has not been called successfully or if this HadoopConnection does not support map/reduce.
        See Also:
        #isMapReduceSupported()}

      • getMapReduceInfoService

        public HadoopMapReduceInfoService getMapReduceInfoService()
        Gets service that provides Hadoop API version dependent operations. This method may only be called after successful initialization of the connection. If the connection has not been initialized call getMapReduceInfoService(String, URL, String) instead.
        Returns:
        Adequate HadoopMapReduceInfoService instance for this connection. Never returns null.
        See Also:
        getMapReduceInfoService(String, URL, String), getMapReduceService()

      • getFileSystemConnectionData

        public HadoopFileSystemConnectionData getFileSystemConnectionData()
        Returns parameters which the file system service used when it established its connection.
        Returns:
        file system service connection parameters

      • isMapReduceSupported

        public boolean isMapReduceSupported()
        Indicates whether or not does this HadoopConnection also allow connection to map/reduce jobtracker. That connection does not have to be specified by user and thus not supported. It is not required that this connection is initialized first.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the user has supplied map/reduce jobtracker host address for this connection.

      • validateConnection

        public java.lang.String validateConnection()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Validates configured connection to file system of Hadoop cluster (in case of HDFS that is connection to namenode) and if map/reduce is supported by this connection it also validates connection to jobtracker. The connection is valid if and only if this method does not throw exception and returns null. This method may only be called after successful initialization of the connection.
        Returns:
        null if validation was successful, a message describing validation problem otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If it is not possible to connect to Hadoop file system or jobtracker. In such case connection is invalid.
        See Also:
        init()

      • free

        public void free()
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is de-initialization method for this graph element. All resources allocated in IGraphElement.init() method should be released here. This method is invoked only once at the end of this graph element existence.
        Specified by:
        free in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        free in class GraphElement

        Throws:
